snippet: Sanitation trucks were working to clear the roads as New York’s new mayor, Bill de Blasio, told residents to “be extremely careful going outdoors.”
abstract: Menacing storm that charted a relentless course across the Midwest churns into New York region, delivering an overnight barrage of heavy snow and high winds; sanitation trucks are working to clear the roads, as New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio tells residents to be extremely careful outdoors.

byline.original: By JAMES BARRON and STEVEN YACCINO
byline.contributor: Matt Flegenheimer, Ariel Kaminer and Kate Taylor contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Sanitation trucks were working to clear the roads as New York’s new mayor, Bill de Blasio, told residents to “be extremely careful going outdoors.”

headline.main: A Plea for Patience as Plows Fan Out Across the City
headline.print_headline: A Snowstorm Brings Delays, and Preparations

keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
keywords.name: organizations
